specializations.1: Criminal Law: Defending clients in complex criminal cases, preparing appropriate defenses, and analyzing criminal evidence.
specializations.2: Family Law: Handling family-related cases such as divorce, child custody, and property division.
specializations.3: Commercial Law: Providing legal consultation and representation in business disputes, commercial contracts, and arbitration.
specializations.4: Civil Law: Addressing civil matters, including contract disputes, personal status laws, and civil liabilities.

aboutUs.Goals: We strive to provide integrated and sustainable solutions in the fields of energy and water by executing high-quality engineering projects. Our goal is to achieve customer satisfaction by delivering the best engineering services and adhering to global standards in all stages of design, preparation, execution, and maintenance. This contributes to the development of infrastructure and increased productivity across various sectors.
aboutUs.historyContent: The company was established in the early 1990s in 1994 as Al-Sayer Office for Engineering Services to carry out the preparation and qualification of electrical power systems. In 1999, the office expanded its activities to include contracting work in addition to preparation, implementation, and design. In 2009, the legal status of the office was adjusted to become Al-Sayer Engineering Services Company. In 2014, the company changed its name to include contracting activities, becoming Al-Sayer General Trading and Contracting and Engineering Services Company. The company is considered one of the key players in the energy sector (oil and electricity).

historyList.1: Lawyer and Judge: lawyer has over 25 years of experience practicing law, including serving as a judge in civil and commercial courts in Baghdad and Basra.
historyList.2: Commercial Court Judge: Presided over complex commercial disputes and contract cases as a judge at the Commercial Court in Basra.
historyList.3: Civil Court Judge: Oversaw civil cases in several courts, including Basra and Maqil.
historyList.4: Family Court Judge: Led family court cases in Sadr City, handling complex family matters and ensuring the protection of family rights.
historyList.5: Advisor in Corruption and Immigration Cases: Developed investigation procedures for corruption and immigration cases, and supervised Interpol inquiries at the highest levels.

publications.1: Editor-in-Chief: Supervised the publication of the 'Legal Truth' magazine from 2008 to 2016, specializing in legal affairs.
publications.2: Legal Articles: Authored numerous articles in the Iraqi Judicial Council newspaper and legal digital magazine, discussing various legal issues.
publications.3: Television Programs: Featured in a prominent television show, 'Legal Files', which focused on important legal matters in Iraq.
publications.4: Notable Judicial Decisions: Delivered key legal rulings in the Federal Court and Basra Court of Appeal, including cases on civil rights protection and legislative annulment.
